content.prompt: Chartres Cathedral differs from early Christian churches constructed on a basilican plan, such as Santa Sabina, in that Chartres has

choices.label: a central nave space flanked by side aisles
a floor plan that includes a transept, a choir, and radiating chapels
an interior space that permits liturgical features such as processions
a longitudinal focus on the altar area

unit.text: 3: Early Europe and Colonial Americas, 200 - 1750 CE

topic.text: 3.1: Cultural Contexts of Early European and Colonial American Art

skill.text: Skill 4.A: Explain how a specific work of art (or group of related works of art) demonstrates continuity and/or change within an artistic tradition, style, or practice.
